input.title: Exploring the Role of AI-Generated Feedback in Studio-Based Design Education
input.abstract: This study investigates how AI-generated feedback influences the iterative design process in a university-level product design studio. Using a qualitative, exploratory approach, we observed 24 students over a 10-week course, collecting reflection journals and semi-structured interviews. Findings reveal that AI feedback accelerated ideation but sometimes narrowed students' creative scope, raising questions about the balance between efficiency and open-ended exploration in design education.

suggested_keywords.notes: Central phenomenon under investigation; likely to shape the research question.
Describes the design activity observed; could guide methodology framing.
A tension identified in the findings; adds a critical lens.
Frames the contribution within design education literature.
Reflection journals are a key data source, tying to reflective practice.

input.title: Optimizing Urban Bus Route Networks Using Multi-Objective Genetic Algorithms
input.abstract: This paper presents a multi-objective optimization framework for redesigning urban bus routes to minimize passenger travel time and operational cost. A genetic algorithm is applied to real-world transit data from a mid-sized city, demonstrating a 12% reduction in average commute time. The results suggest practical guidelines for transit planners seeking cost-effective network improvements.

suggested_keywords.notes: Reframing keyword: positions the optimization as a design problem.
Shifts framing from algorithmic output toward user-centered understanding.
Core methodological concept driving the analysis.
Practical guidelines map well to a constructive contribution framing.
Introduces a critical angle — whose travel time is being optimized?
